Dialog.text: Howzit Officer Bhatia.
You're too late, I'm afraid. By the time you hear this, I should be sitting nice and comfy on an escape pod headed home.
I knew Riley would send you.
Dialog.notes: emphasis on you. claire respects bhatia. under different circumstances they might have been good friends.

Dialog.text: Anybody else and they'd be dead already. You want to stay not dead... then listen up, my chommie.
That little puff of air you just heard? Neurotoxin. Kill you chop-chop, but... I'm giving you the location of the antidote.
I realize you have the means to scuttle my pod. So now you get to decide... self-preservation... or duty to your employer.
What's it going to be, Vijay?
Tick tock.
Vijay... don't.
Good boy. You made the right choice, Vijay.
You manage to get off the moon alive, I'll look you up. I'll make you another offer you can't refuse.
KASMA's always on the prowl for solid men. The pay is shit but the work is loads more fun.
Best of luck to you.
Sorry about your men.
You don't owe Riley a thing. Sticking around like a good little boy to mop the mess she made?
You should be on a pod. Like me. Like she is.
What? You cross at me for clapping your men?
Maybe I'm not the only one on this pod, ay? You think about that?
You push that button and you got innocent blood on your conscience.
I don't believe it. You--[explosion]
Dialog.notes: SFX The escape pod Claire is in detonates.
